item.title: Amazon offers to pay college fees for 750,000 US staff
item.description: The online shopping giant says all US frontline workers will be eligible as it fights to attract new employees.

item.title: Ikea in talks to buy former Topshop flagship store
item.description: The Swedish furniture giant could gain space in the popular London shopping location.

item.title: Costa gives 5% pay rise to some staff and recruits 2,000
item.description: Costa said the 5% pay rise was to reward 14,500 staff for their hard work during the pandemic.

item.title: McDonald's plant burger launch late to vegan party
item.description: The chain announces its McPlant burger will be on offer nationwide next year, after years of research.

item.title: Accountancy giant KPMG to recruit more working class staff
item.description: By 2030, KPMG wants 29% of its senior staff to have parents that worked in "routine and manual" jobs.

item.title: EasyJet rejects takeover bid and seeks to raise more money
item.description: The airline says a recent takeover approach undervalued the business and announces plans to raise £1.2bn.

item.title: Morrisons warns driver shortage will raise prices
item.description: Transport secretary Grant Shapps says the UK must "stand on its own two feet" and not rely on EU drivers.

item.title: Three brings in EU roaming charges and ends global scheme
item.description: Three is the third UK network to bring back roaming charges for the EU post-Brexit.

item.title: Ford is latest firm to stop making cars in India
item.description: The firm has run up losses of more than $2bn in India and demand for new vehicles has weakened.

item.title: Numbers on furlough drop to new low
item.description: The number of young people on furlough falls, but older people and travel workers are less fortunate.

item.title: 888 agrees to buy William Hill European business
item.description: The online gambling firm has agreed to buy the non-US assets of betting chain William Hill for £2.2bn.

item.title: Ofgem warns soaring gas prices will feed into customer bills
item.description: The energy watchdog says that rising prices for fossil fuels, especially gas, will feed into household bills.

item.title: Facebook accused of allowing sexist job advertising
item.description: An investigation by Global Witness suggests its algorithm is biased in choosing who sees which ads.

item.title: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes 'lied and cheated', trial hears
item.description: Elizabeth Holmes pretended her blood-testing technology worked in order to enrich herself, prosecutors say.

item.title: UK 'cut climate pledges' to clinch Australia trade deal
item.description: Government ministers agreed to cut climate commitments to clinch the deal it has emerged.

item.title: UK on course to drop from Germany's top 10 trading partners
item.description: Customs rules take their toll as German companies swap UK suppliers for alternatives in the EU.

item.title: Green and amber lists could go in travel rules shake-up
item.description: The BBC has been told that the green and amber categories could be removed and replaced with a new system.

item.title: Competition watchdog clears Viagogo-Stubhub merger
item.description: Viagogo can go ahead with its £3bn acquisition of rival StubHub, the CMA says.

item.title: The models that turned Instagram into their DIY catwalk
item.description: New York Fashion Week marks a tentative return - but how did supermodels keep working through Covid?

item.title: CEO Secrets: The bra boss busting stereotypes
item.description: Leanne Cahill, CEO of Bravissimo, shares her journey from shop floor to boardroom in retail.

item.title: Why coders love the AI that could put them out of a job
item.description: Artificial intelligence is getting better at penning code but still a long way from working alone.

item.title: Has Covid killed off business cards for good?
item.description: Sales of business cards have fallen sharply as a result of the pandemic.

item.title: 'Bitcoin fraud cost me £500,000'
item.description: A successful businessman saw his life savings wiped out when he fell victim to ruthless fraudsters.

item.title: Why picking a good company name is a tricky business
item.description: With the number of new start-ups soaring they all have to choose a name for themselves.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'I was making money, but had no money'
item.description: Honey boss Scott Davies says cash flow problems meant though he was profitable he "had no money".

item.title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
item.description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: The pubs and restaurants counting on Christmas cheer
item.description: In a bid to rebound from Covid plans for this year's festive season are under way.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.
